body.name: BOB Gear® Deluxe Snack Tray for Single Jogging Strollers
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Sunday, February 18. Order within 21 hrs 30 mins
Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 8 hrs 45 mins
features: Sippy cup holder & snack compartment are removable and dishwasher-safe, so cleaning is a breeze
Swivel design releases tray on either side to swing out of the way for easy loading and unloading
Easy to install and remove from your stroller
Compatible BOB Gear Single Jogging Strollers: Alterrain, Alterrain Pro, Rambler, Revolution Flex 2016+/2.0/3.0, Revolution Pro 2016+, Stroller Strides 2016+
body.description: Snack & sip on the go with the BOB Gear® Deluxe Snack Tray for single jogging strollers. Removable sippy cup holder & snack compartment are dishwasher-safe, so cleaning is a breeze. Tray releases on either side, swinging out of the way for easy loading and unloading. Plus, it’s easy to install and remove. Compatible with all 2016+ BOB Gear® single jogging strollers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Finally! The perfect snack tray for my favorite stroller!
reviews.reviewText: I did so much research when buying a stroller then settled on the BOB Alterrain Pro, it’s my dream stroller and I absolutely love it, but the one thing I didn’t look at was whether the BOB single jogger snack tray would work for my model…it didn’t and I was devastated. After my purchase I read a rumor online that they were in the process of creating one for the Alterrain because others shared my disappointment, so I kept my dream stroller and held onto hope. Fast forward a year or so they release this snack tray. I was so thrilled but then read the reviews… SO MANY complaints that it sits too high or is useless. I was devastated all over again but I ordered it anyway, because useless or not, I was desperate. And I’m so glad I did because it’s perfect!!Instillation was quick and easy. I can easily unlatch the snack tray and swing it outwards with one hand while holding my toddler in the other. I’m genuinely confused on the reviews complaining about the height. It does look like it sits too tall, but as soon as I strap my toddler (14mo) in, it looks proportional. She can see over the snack tray, reach the snacks in the holder, reach her sippy, and can easily put them back in the tray when she’s done. It has absolutely upgraded her stroller experience and I highly recommend this product!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just get it.
reviews.reviewText: For the person who has been looking consistently but hasn’t pulled the trigger, here is your review :I’m so happy I decided to get the snack tray! I’m gonna start off by say, I love it. I’ve had it for about 2 months now and I find myself using my Bob more now because of the snack tray. We also have an UB vista and I love it, but my life style is more active, so the Bob is better. The ease of putting it on is 10/10. When I got the all-terrain version, I almost didn’t because I wanted a snak tray and I saw no spot for it. The snack tray comes the attachments for the stroller. When I’m not using the tray, I just leave the attachments on. My only complaints. It’s a little high, but my little can still grab inside. The actual snack container is supposed to come out, I can’t figure out how to get it out to clean, so I’m just wiping it down. But 9.6/10, I recommended. Get it. Your won’t regret

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Cool but too tall for my kid
reviews.reviewText: The tray is just too tall once attached to the stroller. My 18 M kid can barely reach into the tray and definitely can’t see what’s in the tray. I guess if he was 5 or something it might work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use tray.
reviews.reviewText: Perfect tray 👌 It is easy to put on, take off, and just swing it to the side. It's not straight flat across, instead it's a little high so that you can more easily place child in seat and reach under the tray to do the buckle - but not so high that my 18 month old grandson can't reach his snack and drink. He loves replacing his cup and reaching in for whatever treat!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars So high my LO can't see what's in it
reviews.reviewText: This design is ridiculous. I'm sad too because it's my understanding that there is no other snack tray that will fit to the BOB Allterrain Pro (because if it weren't the only one, I obviously would not have spent $50 on a plastic snack tray).It sits so high that my little one cannot see what is in it. The whole point of getting this was so that I wouldn't have to stop every minute to hand my son another snack, so that he could feed himself as I continued to walk. Since he can't see anything in the tray, this tray renders itself useless. What a bizarre set up. I wish they made another tray to go with my stroller model. So so so disappointed.Also, another side note of disappointment: sippy cups with handles cannot fit the cup holder. *Sigh*

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I don't get the negative reviews of this at all. Our 18 month old is not tall and can see over this just fine and easily reach her snacks. She really likes it when we are on longer outings. Easy to take on and off and solidly made.A little expensive yes but your options are this or nothing really.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Sits too high
reviews.reviewText: Should’ve read reviews from other stores, but this sits too high, makes no sense. It blocks the view of my child, and they are pretty tall for their age. They can’t see their tray or put their cup in the holder because it’s too high. A waste of money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This was a game changer for us to get my toddler excited to get on the stroller for jogs or walks. Highly recommend - we use it daily during our walks/jogs. My toddler is 22 months and the height was perfectly fine. Maybe a tad bit “high” but did not at all prevent her grabbing the snacks. She is a petite toddler in the 20th percentile. Definitely recommend!
